stanza.line: But wherefore do not you a mightierway
Make war upon this bloody tyrant Time
And fortify your self in yourdecay
With means more blessed than my barren rhyme
Now stand you on the top of happyhours
And many maiden gardens yet unset
With virtuous wish would bear you livingflowers
Much liker than your painted counterfeit
So should the lines of life that liferepair
Which this Time pencil or my pupilpen
Neither in inward worth nor outwardfair
Can make you live your self in eyes ofmen
To give away your self keeps your selfstill
And you must live drawn by your own sweetskill
